name: slickly
content:
slickly adverb
(SKILFULLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that operates or happens skilfully and effectively, without problems and without seeming to need effort: Pop music there is dominated by slickly packaged songs and videos. The restaurant is a very slickly run operation with an ambitious menu, well-prepared food, and efficient service.
disapproving in a way that is skilful and effective but not sincere or honest: She offered them employment while also slickly exploiting them. She wasn't sure she wanted to accept his slickly charming offer.
More examplesFewer examplesThe new book is neither slickly written nor edited, but it is sincere.Don't expect slickly trained chefs.He is far more slickly ambitious than his colleagues.He drove slickly into the parking space.They passed the ball around slickly throughout the game.

slickly adverb
(SMOOTHLY)
